title: Poster, Ashes - Public Theater (New York Shakespeare Festival), 1977
title_raw: Ashes - Public Theater (New York Shakespeare Festival)
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
signed: Signature of artist on original drawing appears at lower right corner above the man's shoulder, in script: Paul Davis [copyright symbol] 1977
inscribed: Imprinted in white lower center to lower right: Paul Davis [copyright symbol] copyright 1977 Paul Davis All rights reservd New York Shakespeare Festival A COntemporary Poster Classic [registered trademark] Distributed exclusivly by Darien House Inc. New York CIty. Printed in U.S.A.  Imprinted in blue lower right corner New York Shakespeare Festival stamp showing portrait of Shakespeare.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Poster shows a drawing of a woman in bed, wrapped in a sheet viewed from above. She is curled in a fetal position facing left. Below, at center, a man's head and shoulders. The drawing, possibly originally drawn in oil pastel, is lit strongly from the left. At top in drawn white block capital letters: ASHES. Below across bottom of sheet in whit, stencil-like letters: PUBLIC THEATER. A gray border surrounds the image.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Ashes - Public Theater (New York Shakespeare Festival), 1977. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-205
